docs.snippet: Environmental groups have devised online maps for 13 Western states to tell companies seeking to develop renewable-energy projects what locations are likely to provoke a fight....
docs.lead_paragraph: An overused metaphor in arguments about the environment and electricity projects is "drawing the battle lines.'' But that is exactly what the Natural Resources Defense Council and the Audubon Society did Wednesday, on maps managed by Google, for 13 Western states covering about half the land mass of the continental United States.

docs.snippet: Google releases "eyes-free" applications that make the touch-screen T-Mobile G1 accessible to blind users, and more useful for others....
docs.lead_paragraph: The featureless glassy screens of touch-screen phones may seem like a forbidding barrier for blind users, who often rely on tactile clues to feel their way around. But a pair of engineers at Google, T.V. Raman, who is blind, and Charles Chen, who is sighted, have developed software that makes the touch-screen T-Mobile G1, which uses Google's Android software, more accessible to blind users. They hope the technology will also be useful to anyone who needs to operate a phone without looking at the screen, like drivers.

headline.main: Google's Phone Apps for the Blind, and Everyone Else

docs.abstract: Google releases "eyes-free" applications that make the touch-screen T-Mobile G1 accessible to blind users, and more useful for others.

docs.snippet: YouTube and Universal Music Group, the world's largest music company, plan to create a new online hub for music videos....
docs.lead_paragraph: YouTube and Universal Music Group, the world's largest music company, said on Thursday that they had reached an agreement to create a new online hub for music videos called Vevo. The agreement, which also includes the licensing of Universal recordings for use in user generated videos on YouTube, is the latest of many efforts by YouTube, which is owned by Google, to place more professionally produced content in front of its huge audience, and in turn earn more money from advertising.

headline.main: YouTube in Music Video Deal With Universal

docs.lead_paragraph: What a difference a year or two can make. A quick search of "all news" (in English) on the Nexis database shows that the terms "Brad Grey and Paramount" turn up only 178 hits for the last six months. And a lot of those are fairly neutral stuff, like stories about Paramount's having signed a new deal with the Montecito Picture Company or cut staff (like everyone lately).

docs.snippet: For now, the best one can say is that China is still merely the least-sick patient on the ward....
docs.lead_paragraph: China just reported that it has had the lowest quarterly increase in its economy since 1992. That's not good news -- but it's not as bad as it sounds. Certainly, the 6.1 percent rise still shames the rest of the world -- Singapore's economy has just shrunk twice as fast as China's grew. More important, there are signs that Premier Wen Jiabao's $585 billion stimulus is taking effect. The problem now isn't the efficacy of the medicine but the severity of the side effects. On their own, gross domestic product figures don't mean much. They reflect what was, not what will be, and in China their reliability is always questionable.

headline.main: Signs of Health Stirring in China & Google Barely Dented

docs.snippet: Google News Timeline, a new experimental product, gives users powerful new ways to scan stories and more over time....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google on Monday unveiled a new experimental product called Google News Timeline that displays news and related search results on an interactive timeline. It offers interesting possibilities for exploring stories, especially older ones, that are largely hidden in newspaper and magazine archives. It is also a powerful way to view trends in culture and society or the careers of famous people.

headline.main: Google News, and More, on a Timeline

docs.abstract: Google News Timeline, a new experimental product, gives users powerful new ways to scan stories and more over time.

docs.snippet: ELLIS--Lilli, of Queens, 96, died peacefully April 17, 2009. Wife of the late Robert Ellis, brother of Erwin Herrnstadt. Born in Germany, she escaped in 1939 to Shanghai, and later came to New York. Lilli, a surgical nurse, read the Times daily an...
docs.lead_paragraph: ELLIS--Lilli, of Queens, 96, died peacefully April 17, 2009. Wife of the late Robert Ellis, brother of Erwin Herrnstadt. Born in Germany, she escaped in 1939 to Shanghai, and later came to New York. Lilli, a surgical nurse, read the Times daily and could discuss anything from genetics to Google. She enjoyed conversations with friends of all ages. Her memory was faultless. We will greatly miss this woman of extraordinary strength and character, whose loving, warm-hearted nature, wisdom, and keen intelligence we will remember always. Service on Sunday May 3, 3pm, Parkside Memorial Chapel, 98-60 Queens Blvd., Forest Hills, NY. Donations can be made to UJA Federation of New York, 130 E. 59th St., New York, NY 10022.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  ELLIS, LILLI

docs.snippet: A linguistic proposal related to carbon and climate....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the spirit of accuracy and settling on a common lexicon for climate discourse, I'd like to propose that a certain bit of climate shorthand go away.
